body: @FrozenGene If that's the case, would you mind opening an issue tracking all topi ops we might want to modify?
@anijain2305 Added.
Thanks @manupa-arm @mbaret
@wweic Comments addressed. PTAL.

Did a brief search and here is a list of TOPI files that has the same use case:
- arm_cpu/conv2d_spatial_pack.py
- arm_cpu/conv2d.py
- arm_cpu/depthwise_conv2d.py
- bifrost/conv2d.py
- cuda/conv2d_int8.py
- cuda/conv2d_winograd.py
- cuda/group_conv2d_nchw.py
- mali/conv2d.py

btw just curious, do you have an experimental result with an isolated case to illustrate the accuracy issue introduced by `debug_skip_region`?
Thanks @tqchen

@comaniac One way to verify this is to directly build a tvm func involving debug_skip_region. I verified that on x86 and debug_skip_region did cause inaccurate measurement. However, I didn't dig into why debug_skip_region causes this. For other platforms, @FrozenGene notices this issue also exists. We might want to verify on other platforms and fix them.
cc @zhiics @yzhliu @ZihengJiang @Hzfengsy
This PR is merged
@yzhliu Unfortunately I don't have an example. It's written in my notes that "we should end with rw because it factors multipliers out". If it's only that, it's probably not that important.

Ideally we want to minimize the number of member functions being provide. Given that this is an utility function, it would be better to make it as a public global function rather than a member function. Perhaps we should simply fix `tvm::Dump`.
@vinx13 would be great if you can help to take a look
Thanks for reporting the problem, the community uses the discuss forum for general trouble shooting please open a new thread on https://discuss.tvm.ai/
ping @liangfu
cc @zhiics @comaniac @mbaret
Thanks @siju-samuel

Seems doable. `kExternalSymbol` is added by graph partition pass, so as long as we can make sure the build flow after graph partition pass won't mess up with `kExternalSymbol` and `kGlobalSymbol`, we should be good.

I checked the flow after graph partition pass and mainly located to `compiler engine` and `customized codegen`.

1. Since `compile_engine::LowerExternalFunctions` will first check if `kCompiler` is defined before retriving `kExternalSymbol`, this part should be safe.

2. `customzed codegen` will only receive extenral functions, so it should not matter which symbol we use.

@zhiics please double confirm if I missed anything.

> Ideally we want to minimize the number of member functions being provide. Given that this is an utility function, it would be better to make it as a public global function rather than a member function. Perhaps we should simply fix `tvm::Dump`.

That is ok to me.  Minor addition to Dump works fine too.  FYI, vscode watch cannot find tvm::Dump, but lldb command line works.
I think we can just replace it as we really only use for runtime lookup. @comaniac you have time to give it a try?
Please do take note of the type change(from StringImm to runtime::String)
@tqchen runtime::String hasn't yet been exposed to Python side, right?
Not yet, but we have directly use it to store the GlobalSymbol on the c++ side, this is a TODO in #5047 . If we need a quick python function, we can expose a quick constructor function for now
Good catch. I can confirm both `tvm.nd.empty` and `debug_skip_region` will cause inaccurate measurement from my experiences.
Thanks. I will wait for https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/pull/5200 to get merged and re-run with my PR and add the numbers here. Then, we can merge.
@tqchen sounds good. I can send a quick change on this. We need it from Python as well. I will expose it.

cc @tqchen @comaniac 

Maybe I should create a separate PR for the `String` object so that we can track it more conveniently?
Thanks @yzhliu @zhiics
cc @yzhliu @ZihengJiang @zhiics
NOTE: this PR is sufficient for our current need, however, we will need to followup to make String behave more like a py str later
Rebased. Sorry for the late update.
Open https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/issues/5215 to track this issue.
Thanks @wpan11nv
@merrymercy @FrozenGene Do we keep empty array for now and wait for non_empty array?

> * Update the tutorial
> * Update the doc
> * Remove `_update_inputs_from_pairs` and use Dict's update method directly everywhere
> * Minor code style change (for loop)
> * `input_vars` -> `outputs` and `inputs` -> `outputs`.

Ok - will do. I wasn't sure about the inputs rename, happy to change it back.

> @jjohnson-arm need to update the tutorial too.

Will look at this now.

Hi @zhiics, we have updated the code for the comments. Would you like to review again when you are free? https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/pull/4459/commits/8ac182f0b6c589fa952d9806704386836725a2e4
I am happy with keeping the empty array and merging this first.

@jjohnson-arm Unfortunately, you've just hit a known flaky test failure. Please comment out the get_valid_count test. See https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/pull/4901#issuecomment-595040094

Also have you verified that torch frontend tests work with this PR? I'm not sure some of the usage of `update()` method is supported.

> @jjohnson-arm Unfortunately, you've just hit a known flaky test failure. Please comment out the get_valid_count test. See [#4901 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/pull/4901#issuecomment-595040094)
> 
> Also have you verified that torch frontend tests work with this PR? I'm not sure some of the usage of `update()` method is supported.

Will comment out the test.
I have been runnning the `tests/python/frontend/pytorch/test_forward.py` tests for all my changes, and it works fine (using Python 3.6.10). Seems that python from 3.5 has supported tuples etc - https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/stdtypes.html?highlight=update#dict.update, so should be okay?
ok good to know. I was thinking the arg of update should be dict.
I think @gmagogsfm had a concern about the variable number of inputs/outputs, has this been fixed?
Thanks @jjohnson-arm this is merged!
Did you push the wrong code to this branch? The codes are same as another PR
Thanks for reporting the problem, the community uses the discuss forum for such kind of trouble shooting questions, please open a new thread there
@Hzfengsy sorry, just fixed
Thanks @hzfan for keep improving the code and maintaining a high standard. Thanks @yzhliu @Hzfengsy for helpful reviews, this PR is now merged

We intentionally keep the graph runtime header inside `src/` because they are considered as private APIs used inside the project and are not public APIs. We prefer to use the public PackedFunc and NDArray API to handle all the executions related to the gaph runtime and other generated code.

Such unification will also bring benefit later when we decide to swap the implementation of the graph runtime to other backends(e.g. vm or AOT)
cc @yzhliu @ZihengJiang
This is a known limitation for now. Because we have not yet add text printer support for the TIR. Will keep this issue open until the text printer lands. cc @Hzfengsy @spectrometerHBH
@zhiics @comaniac @mbaret
as part of the principle, would be great if we can lookinto making the native op as fast
also cc @hzfan
Thanks for the clarification. Closing this now.
Thanks @siju-samuel @wyc-ruiker
cc @zhiics @yzhliu @ZihengJiang
https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/pull/5225 should provide a temporary fix to enable printing for IRModule with PrimFuncs, note that however the text format cannot yet be parsed

Oh I miss it. @gmagogsfm remind a nice mechanism in TF to handle variable number of input tensors which will greatly simplify the current op definitions.

I tend to make it in next PR, because currently we rely on template argument
```NUM_INPUTS``` to invoke variadic TVM function with array typed input arguments. If we use ```input: list(T)``` to define variable inputs, we have to get another way to do the invocation. Any suggestions for this improvement @tobegit3hub ?

@wrongtest 
You can invoke TVM packed func with a variadic number of inputs with TVMArgsSetter

https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/e0122c0ea68043372220e4e02b81692c34832227/src/runtime/contrib/example_ext_runtime/example_ext_runtime.cc#L191

Let me know if you have other questions, happy to help.

> Are the C sources currently being linted?

Yes, all sources (including C and C++ source code) under `src` directory are checked by the cpplint, see https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/6e1cd8256e461deca51e45e7aae33088e8f5b966/Makefile#L76

@tqchen Yes, I understand that. But the latency difference could be 10x between tvm schedule and cudnn for the input shape like [100, 1024] on V100. I guess to achieve such performance it requires fusion across multiple stage of reduction, which it seems not easy to be implemented in tir.
Thanks for your help! We update the code and now there is no need to define different op for different input args. @gmagogsfm
Thanks @siju-samuel

> I am happy with keeping the empty array and merging this first.

+1
Created a new pull request.

cc @icemelon9 re let node, let us not expand letnode for now, as they could be useful in Dataflow normal form and marks boundries of the dataflow regions and effect
@wweic Fixed.
`gather_nd` in relay follows the [mxnet semantics](https://mxnet.apache.org/api/python/docs/api/ndarray/op/index.html#mxnet.ndarray.op.gather_nd) where each column indicates the indices in the data.
@FrozenGene @yzhliu Can you take a look as well? Idea is that if input channel == 1, the depthwise conv becomes simple conv.

Hi, I only managed to investigate it further, today. XGBoost now is version `1.0.2`, and I can still reproduce this issue.

To give some context, this is the function call that triggers the issue:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/54975a3fd24fa45b815be39075f4614e53009444/python/tvm/autotvm/tuner/xgboost_cost_model.py#L262-L272

I tried just creating pickle files of some inputs (`self.xgb_params` and `dtrain`) and simplifying the function call, but this is not enough to reproduce the issue. The issue seems to be in the context  `custom_callback`, below:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-tvm/blob/54975a3fd24fa45b815be39075f4614e53009444/python/tvm/autotvm/tuner/xgboost_cost_model.py#L419-L526

Now, something that could help me a bit to narrow down where the problem is if I run XGBoost in debug mode. @hcho3 what is the simplest way I can do that?
please followup, or close the PR if it is superseded by the later ones
The context for the change is this - https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/23563

I tuned mobilenet v2, I dont see any difference in e2e perf, but I see that some depthwise convs are picking up unroll_kw = True (introduced by this PR). Configs for all the depthwise convs are 

~~~
[('tile_ic', [-1, 32]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 32]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,359
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,1217
[('tile_ic', [-1, 16]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 16]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 4]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,2378
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,1430
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 14]), ('unroll_kw', True)],None,859
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 14]), ('unroll_kw', True)],None,859
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,859
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', True)],None,85
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', True)],None,85
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', True)],None,85
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', True)],None,85
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 14]), ('unroll_kw', True)],None,1433
[('tile_ic', [-1, 8]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 8]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 14]), ('unroll_kw', True)],None,1433
[('tile_ic', [-1, 4]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 4]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,948
[('tile_ic', [-1, 4]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 4]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,1655
[('tile_ic', [-1, 4]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 4]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,1655
[('tile_ic', [-1, 4]), ('tile_oc', [-1, 4]), ('tile_ow', [-1, 1]), ('unroll_kw', False)],None,1655
~~~
@dpankratz @kazum @Huyuwei can you also followup? Seems the main error was due to the fact that we are using int64_t::max value in some places to indicate infty, and that goes out of bound in i32
